intro: Sonchus beltraniae, commonly known as the Beltrania sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands and along riverbanks. Its leaves are hairy and lobed, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is often considered a weed but has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
